file_content.text: Welcome back, Captain. Senator Dodonna's already called to rave about how you just saved her life.
Meaning the whole Republic's backing you when you finally take down Rogun. Not bad for somebody from the wrong side of the hyperlane.
If Rogun goes down, as far as anyone's concerned, I did it single-handedly. With a spoon.
I'm not sharing the credit.
Blindfolded and after four shots of Corellian whiskey. Of course.
When did you two decide that I want to start hunting down the most brutal gangster in the entire galaxy?
You're both trying to kill me.
Unless you like being ambushed in every spaceport, I don't think the Butcher's giving you much choice.
You're definitely off to a good start. He's lost a lot of influence since you cut him off from the Hutts.
Did you find out what those beasts were that attacked her?
What about the creatures?
Let me get the Senator on the link. She's going to want to hear what I've found.
What is it? And talk quickly. I got pulled out of a vote for this.
Creatures Rogun sent at you seem to be cybernetically modified versions of native Vossian wildlife.
Voss!
As far as I know, no native animal has ever been legally exported off Voss.
Is this somewhere I should have heard of?
Voss?
Voss is a newly discovered world. Very isolationist--they're governed by some strange cult of Force users. I'll try to wrangle you a landing permit, but it will take time.
It's time to track down who's been playing zookeeper for Rogun.
Someone smuggled them.
How does this get me closer to feeding Rogun his own eyeballs?
Who cares?
We don't have direct access to Rogun, but maybe his suppliers on Voss do.
Voss is a strange place, newly discovered, very isolationist. I'll pull some strings and get you a landing permit, but it will take a while.
We shouldn't wait. Rogun's finally vulnerable, and the captain's gained quite a reputation recently.
If anyone's going to step into Rogun's shoes, Captain, this is the time, and yours are the lovely feet.
If anyone's going to conquer his criminal empire, Captain, this is the time, and you're the man with the crown.
I wouldn't turn down a chance to rule the galactic underworld with an iron fist.
Sounds fun.
Don't think it will be that easy, Captain.
But worth the price.
I want to help the Republic, not run some crime family.
I'm a patriot, not a gangster.
Yeah, the captain's no crime lord. She's a... a shining example of independent spirit!
Yeah. The captain's no crime lord. He's a... a hero-for-hire!
Rogun's got assets the Republic can't touch. Plus, if you take over for him, you can stop worrying about him always trying to kill you.
Rogun is a weapon in the Voidwolf's hand. You can do the Republic no greater service than to eliminate him.
What are Rogun's weaknesses?
What else do we know?
Unfortunately, the only one who knew all of Rogun's secrets was his mentor, Ivory. And he disappeared years ago.
That's not... entirely true.
Rogun's predecessor was arrested by the Republic. To my knowledge, he is still incarcerated in a top secret facility on Belsavis.
This is highly restricted knowledge. Even within the Senate, not everyone knows of Belsavis. You must not repeat any part of this.
If this Ivory's been locked up long enough, we should be able to buy his cooperation with a few rolls of spice and some shaving cream.
Let's get him.
Isn't that more the Empire's sort of thing?
A secret prison planet?
It's hard to be the good guy. If you don't kill offenders outright, you need a place to put them.
Voss sounds more promising.
Seems like a long shot.
It may take months to get the permits for Voss. Belsavis will be easier.
Ivory and Rogun were like father and son. If you can find him, he'll know Rogun's hideouts, stashes, things we'd never find ourselves.
This is a man who used to sell children to the Hutts for gladiatorial games. The Republic will insist on tight restrictions for dealing with him.
But it's worth it. If you're going to war with Rogun, Belsavis will be your first battleground. I'll get the permits in order.
Rogun has no idea who's coming after him....
